column4: see what it says for a folder that doesnt have all those special mounts underneath it
and @sacarlson: this is happening with all my files. using lubuntu 12.04 on a 40gb ext4 hdd
can you maybe send a screenshot or something
can't send you a screenshot, sorry, but the file properties for / say 7.2 GB total size of files and 48.4 GB size on disk. (installed the os yesterday)
its probably just confused by some of the stuff in /proc or /sys
well, /proc and /sys return ~1.6 GB total size and no size on disk
while the rest of the directories is 5.7 GB total size of files and 48.6 GB size on disk
baobob can help you narrow down where this is coming from. do you have encrypted home?
and my nearly-empty-except-for-configs home directory is 104.8 MB total size and 820.6 MB size on disk
maybe someone forgot to divide by 8 in the code. i dont know what filemanager you are using that is reporting these numbers but try baobob
did you say chromium or chromium-browser?
i tried both chromium and chromium-browser. anyway the problem has been rectified - in other news, why is seamonkey no longer part of the main repositories?
chromium is a 2d side scroller.... fun but not a browser
